speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the skin lesions - how old are they, and when did they start appearing?

speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, they just started a few days ago, and my mom says they've been growing a little bit every day. I don't really know, I've just been playing and running around like normal."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the lesions themselves - are they painful, itchy, or do they bleed when you touch them?

speaker: Patient
text: "They're not itchy, and they don't hurt when I touch them. They're actually kinda soft and feel a bit squishy, like a pimple, but they don't feel like they're going to pop or anything."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your overall health lately - have you had any fever, been feeling weak or tired, or have you noticed any other unusual symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I haven't had a fever. My mom says I've been playing and running around like normal, so I don't feel weak or tired. I just feel a little bit... different, I guess."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you show me where the lesions are located on your body? Are they all over, or are they concentrated in one area?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Um, they're mostly on my tummy and legs, but I think I have some on my arms too. My mom said I had a few on my back yesterday, but I don't really remember."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me if you've noticed any other changes in your skin, such as redness, swelling, or discoloration around the lesions? And can you show me exactly where on your tummy and legs you have these lesions, so I can get a better look?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yeah, my mom says they're not red or swollen, just kind of... shiny, I guess. And, um, I'll show you where they are. *points to tummy and legs* See, they're on my tummy, and here on my legs. I think I had a few on my back too, like I said before, but I don't know where exactly."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me if you've been around anyone who's been sick recently, or if you've been exposed to anything unusual like insects or plants that might be causing this? And, I'd like to take a look at the lesions more closely, can you lift up your shirt so I can examine them on your tummy and legs?

speaker: Patient
text: "Uh, my mom says I've been playing with my friends at daycare, and one of them had something on their skin too. I don't know if it's the same thing, but we all played together and had a lot of fun. *lifts up shirt to show doctor the lesions on tummy and legs*"

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the friend who had something on their skin? Do you remember what it looked like or what it felt like? Also, can you show me exactly where on your skin the friend had the lesion, and if it was similar to yours? And, I'd like to take a look at your arms too, since you mentioned you might have some lesions there.

speaker: Patient
text: "Yeah, my friend had a rash on her arm, I think it was on her elbow. It was kinda like a bunch of little bumps, but they were all flat and not squishy like mine. My mom said it looked like chickenpox, but I don't know, I've never seen anything like it before."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so you've been playing with your friends at daycare, and one of them had a rash that looked like chickenpox. Can you tell me more about what happened when you played with your friend? Did you touch her, or did she touch you?" "REQUEST TEST: Stool_Sample" "I'd also like to examine your arms more closely, can you lift them up for me so I can take a look?" "Can you tell me more about your friend's symptoms? Was she feeling sick or uncomfortable when she had the rash, or was it just a normal rash?"

No indication of molluscum bodies (Henderson-Paterson bodies) present. Stool_Sample: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the lesions on your arms? Are they similar in size and shape to the ones on your tummy and legs?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yeah, they're kinda the same, but not exactly. They're a little bit smaller and more scattered, I think. My mom said I have a few on my arms too, but I don't know where exactly, I'm not really sure."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so you have a few lesions on your arms, but they're smaller and more scattered. Can you tell me exactly where you think they might be located on your arms? Are they on your shoulders, elbows, or somewhere else?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Hmm, I'm not really sure. My mom said I had a few on my arms, but I don't really remember where. I think maybe on my biceps or something, but I don't know for sure. I just know I have a few on my arms, and they feel kinda soft and squishy like the ones on my tummy and legs."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your friend's symptoms? Was she feeling sick or uncomfortable when she had the rash, or was it just a normal rash? speaker: Patient

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so the blocks and dolls were new, that's good to know. Can you tell me more about your mom's cleaning routine? Does she disinfect the toys and surfaces regularly?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Yeah, my mom says she washes the toys and surfaces with soap and water, and sometimes she uses a disinfectant spray. I don't know if she does it every day, but she says she does it pretty often. And, she always makes sure to dry everything really well, so it's not all wet and stuff."

speaker: Doctor
